column1: String s1 = "Hello" and String s2 = "Goodbye". To test for equality use s1 == s2.
Overloading is when a subclass contains an inherited method with the same name and same parameters.
Overriding is where one class contains multiple methods with the same name but different parameters.
Employee e1 = new Programmer() is a valid declaration.

column1: The Towers of Hanoi program performs 7 disk moves for 3 disks.
a = 7 and b = 3 If int value = (a < b) ? a : b; then value = 7.
An array's length is set when the array is created and can be changed.
Any method of the Object class may be invoked on an array.
You can't make an array of arrays.
